channel.title: Book Summaries by David Barrett on Shortened Books
channel.description: Recent content in Book Summaries by David Barrett on Shortened Books

item.title: Happier by Tal Ben-Shahar (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Happier: Learn the Secrets to Daily Joy and Lasting Fulfillment” is a self-help book written by Tal Ben-Shahar, a former Harvard University professor and expert in positive psychology.

item.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen R. Covey (Summary & Review)
item.description: “The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People” is a self-help book written by Stephen R.

item.title: Rumi Daylight by Camille Adams Helminski (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Rumi Daylight: A Daybook of Spiritual Guidance” is a book written by Camille Adams Helminski, an author, translator, and spiritual teacher who has focused much of her work on the teachings of Rumi.

item.title: The Bhagavad Gita by Eknath Easwaran (Summary & Review)
item.description: “The Bhagavad Gita” is a Hindu scripture that contains a dialogue between the warrior Arjuna and his charioteer Krishna, who is actually an incarnation of the Hindu god Vishnu.

item.title: Man's Search For Meaning by Viktor Frankl (Summary & Review)
item.description: “Man’s Search for Meaning: An Introduction to Logotherapy” is a book written by Viktor Frankl, a psychiatrist and Holocaust survivor, first published in 1946.

item.title: 12 Rules For Life by Jordan Peterson (Summary & Review)
item.description: “12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos” is a self-help book by Canadian clinical psychologist and psychology professor Jordan Peterson.
